Description: Anklet (?): a very long string of shell disc beads with two long cylinders, two short cylinders and a disc bead, all of green glazed composition, and a single bright-blue glass disc.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 3242 Found at the ankles of a woman
Curator's comments: For dating see W. Y Adams, 'Nubia Corridor to Africa' (London, 1977), 215. Also from this burial: Also from this burial: bracelets (1930,0711.326 & 1930,0711.327), necklaces (1930,0711.331 & 1930,0711.329 1930,0711.330), shells (1930,0711.332). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 120; Tomb register. pl.LXXI; Bead register, pl.LXXIB.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (581)
